---
title: External Derotation Test
---


 • Supine: Bring leg into 90/90. Put leg
into slight external rotation. Resist
active ER into neutral. • Can also be done prone. Bring
leg into slight ER and resist
active IR to neutral.
• Positive Pain = tendonitis • Sensitivity: 88% and Specificity:
97.3% (supine position). • Sensitivity increased to 94% with
negative results in the prone
LATERAL HIP PAIN
position if negative in supine.
